In Belarus, the shadow political prisoners
subhed: Beyond the roughly 1,000 political prisoners who have been officially identified, hundreds more languish in prison without being recorded. The regime of Alexander Lukashenko has done everything it can to keep them hidden and ensure they are forgotten.

Semiconductors: ASML, the tech giant at the center of the US-China conflict in the race for AI
subhed: 'Microchips: The Oil of the 21st Century' (4/5). ASML's ultra-advanced lithography machines are used to etch the most cutting-edge microprocessors, which are crucial for artificial intelligence – a major strategic issue.

title: North Korea's Kim Jong Un orders factories to make more missiles in 2026
subhed: In a visit to munitions factories accompanied by top officials, the state-run Korean Central News Agency (KCNA) said the North Korean leader had ordered the factories to prepare for a busy year ahead.

title: Pop goes the cocktail! Five champagne cocktail recipes for the end-of-year festivities
subhed: While the idea may offend some purists, champagne features prominently in many cocktail recipes. Five bartenders share their personal creations, all featuring prestigious and sublime bubbly.

title: Arthur Hadade, the chameleon who launched the 'Spotify of contemporary art'
subhed: With Cur8, his app dedicated to navigating the contemporary art world, the 35-year-old entrepreneur aims to challenge stereotypes surrounding a field often perceived as highly codified and inaccessible.

Why more young people are turning to religion
subhed: Many researchers have observed a resurgence of religious commitment among young people in France, often accompanied by a certain rigorism. This renewed spiritual quest is linked both to the anxieties of our era and, at times, a search for identity.

title: Algeria demands 'apologies' and 'reparations' from France for its colonial past
byline: By Frédéric Bobin and Hamid Nasri (Algiers, Algeria, correspondent)
subhed: Algerian MPs passed a law on Wednesday, December 24, to 'criminalize French colonization,' amid ongoing diplomatic tensions between Algiers and Paris.

title: Lumpy skin disease: Why are French farms experiencing so many animal disease outbreaks?
subhed: Combined with globalized trade, the overall rise in temperatures driven by human-induced climate change has allowed insects and other vectors of diseases once confined to tropical regions to spread northward.
